title: Educational software design project based on variation theory

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of mathematical concepts and digital tool proficiency
context.additional_context: Learners design math education software in teams, focusing on learning scenario development applying variation theory; emphasizes collaboration using personal devices and iterative design processes

learning_goals: Learners can develop educational software prototypes applying the four design principles of variation theory (guiding learning, clarifying learning objects, varying aspects, keeping other elements invariant)
Learners can analyze and design variation patterns suitable for effectively conveying mathematical concepts (e.g., functions, calculus)
Learners can verify the educational effectiveness of developed software and propose improvements through summative evaluation

resources: Educational software development tools (e.g., Unity, Unreal Engine)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
